sn4.21:1.3: As often, here viharanti, literally “dwell”, means “meditate”.
sn4.21:1.4: The matted hair and antelope hide are well known symbols of the Brahmins. The “cluster fig tree” (udumbara) was used for ritual vessels, posts, and firewood, and was regarded as Prajāpatī’s tree, a special source of vitality (Śatapatha Brāhmaṇa 4.6.1.3).
sn4.21:1.8: Even though these mendicants were diligent, their wisdom was not developed enough for them to recognize Māra.
